content:
/>
III.ii.2.E.4.c
.
Facts and Circumstances
Records containing the facts and circumstances surrounding a service member’s other-than-honorable (OTH) discharge are maintained at the Staff Judge Advocate Office of the installation from where the service member is discharged.  They are typically retained for a period of two years only, after which they are destroyed.
Notes
:
Facts and circumstances are not available through PIES.  A request must be sent directly to the JAG office.
Transcripts of a court martial resulting in an OTH discharge may contain facts and circumstances and must also be obtained via written request to the JAG office.  Addresses for the JAG office for each service department are located in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.E.2.d
.
title: M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section E - Service Record Address Codes and Addresses for Military Records Centers and Other Agencies
citation: Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section E
